newsitem.title: USA: Jaclyn says named in handbag lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: Jaclyn says named in handbag lawsuit.

text.p: Jaclyn Inc said Wednesday that it is involved in a lawsuit relating to the manufacture and sale of a limited number of handbag styles by one of its divisions.
Jaclyn said it denies any allegations relating to this suit, which has no specified monetary damage.
The company is attempting to reach a settlement in order to avoid significant management time and attention to this matter and to reduce legal and other expenses.
A company spokesman was not immediately available for further information.

Anthony Christon, Jaclyn's chief financial officer, said the lawsuit filed by Leegin Creative Leather Products Inc focuses on "intellectual property" infringement of 15 different handbag styles that Jaclyn makes.
Christon said Jaclyn makes hundreds of different styles of handbags and it has filed a countersuit against Leegin.
